item.title: Cool Gmail Feature: Different email addresses for one account
item.description: So, I was talking to Conrad yesterday about gmail, and his email address has a "." in it, name DOT othername @gmail.com. And I told him that Google would ignore the "." in his name if he wanted to drop it for some reason. ...

item.title: Tailgate - Rich Internet Banner Application?
item.description: TechCrunch has an article up about Tailgate, a company that is putting a unique twist on Internet advertising. Instead of having banners where users click through to landing pages, Tailgate integrates e-commerce aspects right into the banners themselves. Users can purchase items directly from the banner, entering their credit card information directly into the "banner application". They have a few samples up on their website, and have had at least one customer for it. The TechCrunch comments are mostly negative towards this, focusing on the fact that most people won't feel secure in entering their credit card information on a

item.title: Find and Replace in MySQL
item.description: I needed to do a find and replace on a couple of fields in a table and was stuck on the best way to this. Initially I was going to download a database dump and via a text editor find/replace and then re-upload but then I found out that MySQL has a Replace() function. [More]

item.title: 360Flex schwag up on the store
item.description: We finally got the cafe press thing figured out! Take a look at the 360Conferences, 360 Flex store!Thanks to Doug (again! Doug really is our hero!) and our pals over at Flying Logo Sisters, we've got some killer graphics for everything from shirts (like this one) to coasters, laptop bags, etc.Remember, if you're staying at the Red Lion and register before the 13th of July, you'll have a $20 gift certificate in your welcome package. Good for anything at the Official online store.Take a look, see what we've got, show your spirit and show up on Mondayin some fly gear!
